name: Lake Rudolph Campground & RV Resort

reviews.text: We rented a standard RV for two nights. It was clean and for the most part comfortable. This is not a hotel so keep that in mind! My only complaint was the mattress in the bedroom. We could actually feel the springs in our backs. The camper had plenty of room. Renting a golf cart is an absolute must. The campground is huge. My son is 12 and he had a blast riding in the golf cart. The camp store was to small and packed full of stuff. The arcade was small. We did play bingo and it was ok. The little ice cream and pizza place had good ice cream and the pizza was fair. The lake is really a big pond. The shuttle to and from Holiday World is great. They cruise the campground continuously and we never waited longer than 5 minutes. The camp is a bit noisy at night but we did not mind. I did see security cruising the site constantly.
reviews.title: Good Family Fun

reviews.text: We just spent a week there at the end of June. Beds were the most uncomfortable we have ever slept on. No rails for top bunks. Standing water in the cookware stored under sink. Exposed nails in doorway snagged clothes and could have injured hands. Roaches and flying bugs that came out only at night. Pine needles and layers of dirt falling out of bathroom vent. Light fixtures that were broken. Broken curtain rod that fell down whenever it was bumped. It is sad that they have not kept up the maintenance and cleaning on these RVs. Campground itself is okay. Very noisy in the evening. Lots of planned activities for the kids.
reviews.title: No more renting RVs here.

reviews.text: Stayed in one of the rental RV units. Unit was very clean. Small inconvenience having to bring linens. Shuttle service to Holiday World worked well. Staff was friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: Great place to stay when visiting Holiday World

reviews.text: We just got back after spending 3 nights at Lake Rudolph and 2 days at Holiday World it was too short and we all decided we need to go back. My kids 9 & 11 were frequently commenting how nice everyone was both at the campground and Holiday World. When you read how clean it is you can't really appreciate it until you are there. We stayed at the cabins which were rustic but comfortable. If you go rent a golf cart it's a must the kids loved it. New cabins were under construction that will have TVs and will be available later this summer. However after our short stay my daughter announced she did not want to stay in the new cabins we had more fun because we didn't have a TV. There is lots to do activities for kids, paddle boats, swimming, excellent little ice cream/pizza place. Golf carting driving around meeting the neighbors some people decorate the carts it's a parade every night.
reviews.title: Unexpected delight we will be back this summer

reviews.text: My extended family of 5 brothers and 5 sisters in their 50's and 60's with children, grandchildren from IN and KY had planned a family reunion for approx. 75 total people renting approx. 8 cabins and 4 rental RV's. Everyone in our family absolutely loved all the facilities and hated to leave. We are already planning another reunion at the same place and time next year. The only thing that was somewhat inconvenient was the temperature was 96 degrees on Saturday when we were there and the lofts in the cabins were too warm at night and the height of the roof was too low for the people sleeping at the far ends of the loft. For that reason, next year, most of us will probably rent either regular size or King size RV's or Santa Family size cabins next year. My family stayed in a King size RV with a King size bed, full size bed, sofa, and 4 bunk beds, plus 1 and 1/2 baths and kitchen and it was fantastic. We had children from 2 mnths to 18 years old along with adults from 21 to 68 and they all stayed busy with all the activities from playing basketball, golfing, swimming, paddle boating, peddle boating, fishing, riding golf carts, etc. The whole campgrounds was immaculate, very few bugs (park is sprayed well), maintenance problems were fixed immediately and correctly. Golf carts must shut off at 11 pm so there was no noise from them while sleeping at night and security patrols in golf carts going past about every 30 minutes. It was truly a wonderful reunion weekend for everyone from 2 months to 68.
reviews.title: excellent family reunion weekend

reviews.text: We had a nice stay at Lake Rudolph this past July while visiting Holiday World. We rented a king-sized RV for our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids), and my brother & sister in law. We had also planned on taking another child with us, but those plans were cancelled. The room & half bath in the King bed my brother & his wife had was very spacious. The room the rest of us shared had a Queen-size bed with a single bunk built right above where one would normally rest your head, and then triple bunks on the wall at the foot of the bed. With just the 4 of us, it was pretty cramped -- I can't imagine how it would have been if we had actually brought another child with us to sleep in the room.
reviews.title: Not Quite as Spacious As I Had Hoped...

reviews.text: One of the triple bunks is practically on the floor -- not an ideal sleeping space. The uppermost bunk was ok -- just a little head room -- but there's no ladder to get on it. You have to climb on the Queen bed just to get on & off of it. Same thing with the bunk above the "head" of the Queen bed -- the person would have to get on & off by stepping on the Queen bed.
reviews.title: We loved it and we'll be back!

reviews.text: The sofa in the living room was a pull-out, which was a surprise since it's not noted on the website that there is a pull-out. Once I saw the "mattress" on the pull-out, I could understand why Lake Rudolph wouldn't want to promote having a pull-out. It was nothing more than a foam mattress and a very thin one at that. I think Lake Rudolph would benefit by installing higher quality mattresses in the pull-outs, and instead of having a triple bunk in the King Size RV, just have a double set with some sort of ladder to get to the top bunk.
reviews.title: Very nice campground

reviews.text: The grounds were very clean, the store had more that I imagined it would (although be prepared as they have a ton of toys & junk for kids). The mini-golf course looked a little rough -- could use a facelift. But it's free, so it's hard to complain about it.
reviews.title: The Details

reviews.text: We didn't get a chance to use the pool, but it looked wonderful.
reviews.title: Better than Griswald Family Fun!

reviews.text: We stayed for three nights and loved the campground. Clean bathroom facilities, a large camp store, and very friendly workers willing to answer any questions. The shuttle to and from Holiday World ran efficiently and we never waited more than a few minutes. Will be back!
reviews.title: Fun, clean and easy access to Holiday World

reviews.text: We stayed at the Christmas cabin last year for 4 days and 3 nights and have already booked our trip for this year. We had stayed at Lake Rudolph before but this time they out did themselves these cabins are awesome. We had 4 adults, 2 teenagers, a baby, and a toddler and everyone was happy. Plenty of room, very nice and comfortable, the TVs are a great addition especially for the little ones to keep them occupied. The kitchen is small but still very workable with full size applicances, the bathroom is spacious other than a small shower but hey it got the job done. I think these cabins actually had more storage than out house! Love it had a great time would recommend to anyone who ask
reviews.title: Christmas Cabin family weekend

reviews.text: We chose Lake Rudolph because of the location next to Holiday World and we didn't want to stay in a boring hotel room. I rented a king size RV here with my husband, 2 kids (5 & 10), sister, nephew, and father. We thought the RV was clean, well equiped with everything we needed, and large enough to accomidate the 7 of us. There was a king bed in one bedroom, a queen bed and 4 bunks in the other. The beds were surprisingly comfortable. There was also 1 1/2 bathrooms.
reviews.title: Good time, Great Campground

reviews.text: We also rented a golf car. The kids loved it! If at any time they were bored we would jump on and go for a ride. It was also very convienent whenever we needed to get around this large campground. It was great seeing all of the decorated golf cars during the parade!
reviews.title: Favorite campsite of all time!!!

reviews.text: There were many fun activites for the kids to do for a small fee. They enjoyed gem minning, sand art, and ceramics. They also have a gameroom and we played a free game of mini golf. We also liked the pool and Blitzen's Kitchen had great pizza and ice cream of every flavor you could imagine!
reviews.title: More fun than you can shake a stick at!

reviews.text: This campground adjoins Holiday World and I believe, is owned by the same people. I wish the value for the campground was as good as Holiday World. We stayed in a king-sized camper, which was all they had available. The camper was nice - 2 bedrooms, bath and 1/2, kitchen, living area. Campsite was adequate - we didn't use it - it was too hot to do much outside. They have lots to do at the campground - pool, hiking paths, kiyaks, golf carts, miniature gold, etc. but we didn't do much of this because of the heat. We had problems with the Wi-Fi access from our camper, we were too far away from the signal. I would recommend renting a golf cart if you are going to do things at the campground. It is a large place. We did not need a golf cart because we took the free shuttle to/from Holiday World. I would give this an excellent rating except the rates are pretty steep. Although, in their defence, everything else in the area is pricey also.
reviews.title: Excellent, but pricey.

reviews.text: Never have been to this area before, I was a little nervous. Our family normally stays at "normal" type hotels and motels. We rented 3 of these new "Santa Clause Cabins". It was a blast. Totally helped our family bond and hang out together. Rented a Golf Cart for a couple of day. This is a must do. There is some sort of freakish "golf cart society" that hangs out there. They drive at night, with colored lights and decorations. At first I thought it was silly and ridiculous, but by the end of the trip, we started decking out our golf cart. What a hoot. It was absolutely one of our favorite things we have ever done as a family and Lake Rudolf was part of the equation. We've been to Disney, Epcot, Florida......etc...
reviews.title: Great hospitality and really added to our positive experience going to Holiday World

reviews.text: This place was one of the best times we have ever had. Don't hesitate, don't think about it....GO!!
reviews.title: Some Pros & Some Cons
Will not stay here again
reviews.text: We returned from our 3 night stay from Lake Rudolph today. The ground staff at the resort were very friendly and helpful. They were visible, and for that reason we felt safe. The pool was clean and well maintained, and the play areas for kids were a big hit. We liked having the Shuttle service to Holiday World was super convenient, and runs frequently. However, there was some cons too....first, let me say we camp ALOT so we know what to expect in campgrounds.....the family cabin that we stayed in fell below my expectations...for several reasons. First, the was an ant infestation, yeah I know when you camp there are going to be bugs..but this was ridiculous. They were everywhere in the kitchen, and we ended up keeping our food in the sterilite containers we brought, outside. This defeated the purpose of upgrading to the cabin to have cabinet space. Secondly, the cabin could have been cleaner...there was alot of dust..clearly visible under the beds, mold around the shower doors etc. The cabins were so close to the road which would have been ok but that was where the fire ring was too...so if you have very young children..not only do you have to keep them away from the fire ( which you expect if you have a fire) but also from the road. We ended up having to stay in more than we liked because of the road and traffic. The most upsetting thing however was the explicit grafitti on the loft ceiling. I went upstairs to check it out it looked OK, but did not lay in bed and look at the ceiling until my five year old started giggling. I went up and was mortified at the pics previous guests had drawn there...it is called a FAMILY cabin. I taped paper over it--if the management could not remove it they could have at least blacked it out. We discovered this at night and did not feel like moving again with 3 little kids so we covered it up as best we could. Sooooo please if you have children and our booking a cabin you may want to specifically request a clean ceiling??!!?

First, let me start off by saying this was my first experience staying in an RV. When we arrived, the first impression I got was dirty. There was mildew all over the sides of the RV. The inside was dirty and just not comfortable. You are very close to your neighbors and can hear every little thing that's going on in their cabin, especially if they are rowdy. Next time we will stay in a hotel. Holiday World/Spashin Safari was great and my two boys loved it.
reviews.title: Convenient but Uncomfortable & quite small

description: Escape to the great outdoors by staying at Lake Rudolph Campground & RV Resort in Santa Claus, Indiana. Voted one of the top ten favorite parks in North America and a two-time National RV Park of the Year, Lake Rudolph is the closest lodging and camping to Holiday World Theme Park & Splashin’ Safari Water Park. Offering 250 Family Cabins & Rental RVs and nearly 230 full hookup RV Sites and Tent Sites, including over 100 paved sites, Lake Rudolph is the perfect solution for your getaway.
